STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 11, 2025
Yulonda W Shell
VISTA MARIA
20651 W WARREN ST,
DEARBORN HEIGHTS, MI, 48127-2622
Re: License #: CI820294390
SI #: 2025SIC0000141
Dear Yulonda W Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000141
Special Investigation Intake Date: November 25, 2024
License #: CI820294390
Licensee Group Organization: Sisters of Good Shepherd
Licensee Designee: Megan Zambiasi
Chief Administrator: Yulonda W Shell
Agency Name: VISTA MARIA
Agency Address: 20651 W WARREN ST
DEARBORN HEIGHTS, MI 48127-2622
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/02/2026
Capacity: 28
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
11/25/2024 Email Other
11/26/2024 Onsite Inspection Special Investigation Initiation
11/26/2024 Face to Face Interview
11/26/2024 Documentation Documentation received or sent
11/26/2024 Email Documentation received or sent
12/04/2024 Face to Face Interview
12/09/2024 Email Documentation received or sent
12/17/2024 Video Conference DHHS Case Conference Dispo
Meeting
12/19/2024 Face to Face Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 (1) A child caring institution shall establish and
Section follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
Description forms of intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including,
but not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was engaged in a verbal argument with a newer staff over
wanting her hair done. The newer staff would not step away or allow
other staff to intervene. The youth threatened to spit on the staff
member. The staff member grabbed the youth by the hands, forcing
them into her mouth. This resulted in the youth sustaining a bloody
lip. The staff member restrained and choked the youth and grabbed
the youth by the jacket.
Investigation Interviews:
On 11/25/2024 an email correspondence was sent to the assigned
FCW advising of the investigation and inquiring about any concerns
with the placement of Youth A. No concerns were noted.
On 11/26/2024 an on-site visit was made to Vista Maria. The DHHS
specialist was also present. An in-person interview was completed
with Compliance. He was advised of the allegations of the special
investigation. He agreed to obtain video footage, policy information,
Incident Reports and all other pertinent information relevant to the
investigation.
On 11/26/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth A.
DHHS Specialist was also present. She reported not feeling safe at
Vista Maria because she got “hit”. She reported that she had got a
cut on the inside of her top lip, but it was basically healed now.
Youth A reported that on Saturday morning she was advised by one
of the staff that she was going to be able to get her hair braided, but
when she asked Staff 1 she responded that she would not be getting
her hair done. Youth A admitted that she got angry and told Staff 1
that she was going to spit on her. Youth A stated that when she
tried to spit, Staff 1 grabbed her arms and tried to put her into a
restraint. She stated it was only Staff 1 that attempted the restraint.
Youth A went on to advise that Staff 1 grabbed her arms with one
hand and twisted them behind her back while pushing her into the
chair. Youth A recalled that she continued trying to spit on Staff 1
and then Staff 3 got between them both and tried to stop her. Youth
2

A stated that a few moments later, Staff 1 got into her face and then
choked her. She described the choking as Staff 1 using two hands
and placed them on her neck. Youth A stated it was hard for her to
breathe, but she was still able to. She reported Staff 1 also hit her in
the face an unknown number of times with a closed fist and used her
forearm and pressed it against her neck and applied pressure; all
while saying to Youth A “stop playing with me”. Youth A stated that
Staff 2 tried to verbally redirect Staff 1 and Staff 3 also tried to get
her to stop, but Staff 1 did not listen. Youth A reported no other staff
was present until Staff 3 went and got Supervisor 1. When
Supervisor 1 arrived, she told Staff 1 to leave the wing. Youth A
stated that her lip was split and was bleeding. She stated she saw a
nurse at Vista and also went to the hospital to get checked out.
Youth A denied any other injuries. On 12/4/2024 another brief in-
person interview was completed with Youth A. She was asked
about Staff 2 being seen placing her hand over the mouth of Youth
A. Youth A reported that Staff 2 was covering her mouth to stop her
from spitting. She denied that she hurt her or stopped her from being
able to breath. She further denied that Staff 2 contributed anyway in
her lip getting cut.
On 11/26/2024 an in-person interview was completed with
Supervisor 1 at Vista Maria. DHHS specialist was also present.
Supervisor 1 stated she became aware of the incident when Staff 3
came to her office and stated “you’ve got to come and get your team
leader, she is out of control”. Staff 3 reported that he had attempted
to tap out Staff 1 three times without success. Supervisor 1 reported
that when she entered the door of the hallway, she observed Youth
A leaning/reclining backwards in a chair. Staff 2 was kneeled down
on the floor next to Youth A attempt to calm her down and Staff 1
was standing/leaning over Youth A with her right forearm against the
neck of Youth A. Supervisor 1 told Staff 1 to leave the wing and
reminded her that restraints are not to be done in a chair. She
reported she observed Youth A to be visibly upset, crying and her lip
was bleeding. Youth A told Supervisor 1 that Staff 1 hit and choked
her. Supervisor 1 confirmed that Youth A was seen by the nurse at
Vista and was later sent to the hospital to be checked out. Staff 1
was also sent for a medical exam as she reported that she was
bitten by Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported that Staff 1 has been
employed by the agency for about 3 to 4 weeks and was hired as a
team lead as she had experience working at other CCI agencies.
She also advised that Staff 1 had successfully completed restraint
training during her onboarding process.
On 11/26/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth B
at Vista Maria. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth B
3

reported she is a resident on B Wing and is familiar with Youth A.
She reported getting along good with Supervisor 1 and feels safe at
the agency. Youth B denied being involved in any incidents where
she felt she was improperly restrained. She reported that she is
aware of the incident that happened with Youth A and Staff 1
because Youth A told her about it. She reported that Youth A told
her that she was choked and hit by Staff 1. Youth B denied having
been restrained by Staff 1 or having knowledge of her restraining
other youth.
On 12/24/2024 contact was made with both Complainants and no
additional areas of concern were noted.
On 12/4/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at Vista
Maria. The DHHS specialist is also present. She reported that she
is a youth coach and has been employed at Vista Maria for 10
months. She confirmed that she was present on the day of the
incident. She recalled it occurred right before breakfast. Staff 2
reported that Youth A was told the day before that she would be
getting her hair done but she didn't know if the staff member who
told her that was going to be available to come over and do it. Staff
2 reported that Youth A asked to speak with Staff 1 to ask her about
it. Staff 1 told Youth A that she would not be getting her hair done
due to her behavior from last week. Youth A began to get angry,
started being rude, and started calling Staff 1 names like gay and
dyke. Youth A also told Staff 1 that she was going to spit on her.
Staff 2 stated that at this point Staff 1 became upset and Staff 3
attempted to tap Staff 1 out, but she did not listen. Youth A started
to walk toward Staff 1, but when she got close enough Staff 1
grabbed her arm and twisted it behind her back and Youth A was
able to turn around and spit toward Staff 1. Staff 3 was standing in
between them and the spit mostly got onto him. Staff 2 reported she
did attempt to place her hand in front of the mouth of Youth A to
prevent her from spitting. Staff 2 stated she did not touch Youth A’s
face, but only put her hand there to try to prevent her from spitting
on anyone and further aggravating the situation. Staff 2 recalled that
after Youth A spit on Staff 1, it was then that Staff 1 “rushed” Youth
A and put her hands around the neck of Youth A and pushed her
down into the chair. Youth A stated, “you are choking me” and Staff
1 stated “no I am not”. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 then began
shoving her forearm into Youth A's mouth and grabbed Youth A's
mouth with her left hand and was using her right forearm to press on
Youth A's neck. This resulted in the lip of Youth A being split. Staff 2
reported that she and Staff 3 attempted to tap Staff 1 out on three or
four occasions, but she refused to leave the area. Staff 3 left the
area and went to get Supervisor 1. When Supervisor 1 arrived, she
4

told Staff 1 to “get her hands off of Youth A and leave. As she was
leaving, Staff 1 reported that Youth A had bit her. Staff 2 stated this
was not true. Staff 2 reported that she had not worked with Staff 1
before. She denied hearing Staff 1 say anything about the camera
being in a blind spot, but did hear her say that she doesn’t want to
work with any “weak ass staff”.
On 12/4/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at Vista
Maria. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 3 reported that
he is a youth coach at Vista Maria and had been employed with the
agency for 3 months. He confirmed that he was present on the day
of the incident with Youth A. Staff 3 reported he has worked with
Staff 1 before, but never seen her behave this way. He reported that
Youth A can be aggressive, and little things can set her off. After
breakfast, Youth A was inquiring about getting her hair done and
Staff 1 was called over to discuss the request with Youth A. He
recalled that Staff 1 told Youth A she was not getting her hair done.
Staff 3 reported that he believed this was because Youth A had
been aggressive earlier in the week and had not demonstrated good
behavior. Staff 3 reported that Youth A began yelling at Staff 1 and
stated: "You're new and you don't know what you're talking about
you dyke". Staff 3 stated that Staff 1 seemed to take the comments
personal and became aggravated. Youth A then started to come
toward Staff 1 and was spitting at her. Staff 3 stated he placed
himself between the two, but Staff 1 grabbed the arm of Youth A and
pushed her forcefully into the chair and was trying to restrain her.
He recalled hearing Staff 1 say “this is a blind spot, no one will see
you on camera”. Staff 3 reported he attempted to tap out Staff 1
several times, but she refused to leave. He reported that he
witnessed Staff 1 twist the arms of Youth A inward toward her body
and Youth A was squirming and trying to get loose. Staff 3 then
went to advise Supervisor 1 and told her that she needed to come
and get Staff 1. Upon arrival of Supervisor 1, Staff 1 was told to let
the youth go and leave and she did not return. He reported that
Youth A's mouth was bleeding, and she received first aid to stop the
bleeding.
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at Vista
Maria. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1 stated she
has been employed by Vista Maria since 10/23/2024. She was
advised of the allegations and confirmed that she was working at the
agency on the day of the incident. She reported that Youth A was
upset about wanting to get her hair done. Staff 1 reported she
advised Youth A that she could get her hair done later. She stated
that there were not many other youth in the area due to the prior
behavior of Youth A. Staff 1 reported she tried to advise Youth A
5

that they were shorthanded and she would have to wait to get her
hair done. Staff 1 stated Youth A became upset and began yelling
and cursing. She stated Youth A came toward her and was saying “I
am going to spit on this bitch”. Staff 1 reported that both Staff 2 and
Staff 3 were present. Staff 1 reported putting her hand up in an
attempt to stop Youth A from spitting on her and push her foot away
as Youth A was attempting to kick her. Staff 1 denied touching
Youth A when she was attempting to stop her from spitting. Staff 3
also denied that she choked Youth A or put her hands near her
neck. She stated she let Youth A go as she was the only one
attempting to restrain her and policy does not allow a one-person
restraint. Staff 3 stated Youth A must have tripped when she was
coming toward her and that is how she ended up in the chair. She
denied that she pushed Youth A into the chair. She recalled that
Staff 2 was attempting to calm Youth A down and denied that any of
the staff attempted to tap her out. Staff 1 stated that the other staff
present only attempted to speak with Youth A. Staff 1 reported that
she felt fearful and wanted to leave the pod but could not because
Staff 3 had already left. A few moments later, she stated Supervisor
1 arrived and told her to leave the unit, so she did. Staff 1 reported
that she informed Supervisor 1 that Youth A bit her and that is why
she went to Concentra for medical follow up. Staff 3 indicated she is
not sure why there is an investigation as she did everything “by the
book”. Staff 1 reported that she did not feel supported by the other
staff present.
On 12/17/2024 a DHHS Dispo case meeting was held. In
attendance was FCW, Area Manager, DHHS Specialist, Program
Manager and myself. A summary of the investigative findings were
shared. Staff 1 was confirmed for findings of physical injury of Youth
A. DCWL reported preliminary findings of non-compliance with
licensing rules and advised that final findings would be provided at
finalization of report.
Video Review:
The footage showed that the incident occurred between 11:08AM
and 11:11AM. In the first video Staff 1 is observed in all black and
she can be seen walking up to Youth A very fast. Staff 2 was
observed to be attempting to prevent Youth A from spitting by
placing her hand in front of Youth A’s mouth. Youth A was seen
walking around/away from Staff 2. Due to the camera angle, it was
difficult to see anything additional as they were out of camera view.
A little later, Staff 3 is seen moving around and engaging with the
other staff and Youth A. Staff 3 is seen grabbing the arm of Staff 1
in an attempt to pull her away from the situation and Staff 1 snatches
her arm back and does not remove herself.
6

The second video was observed to be from the camera from the
other side of the hallway and the images are obstructed due to the
distance and positioning of youth and staff. During the second video
the same actions can be observed by Staff 2 and Staff 3. The
actions of Staff 1 are observed and she can be seen forcefully
pushing Youth A down into the chair. She can also be seen to be
pushing Youth A, who then rolls in the chair back to the wall. Again
Staff 2 and Staff 3 are seen attempting to intervene. A few moments
later, Supervisor 1 enters through the door and Staff 1 leaves.
Additional video footage was provided by Compliance for review
based on statements by Youth A that she was inappropriately
restrained. The video footage was reviewed, and no areas of
concern were noted. Youth A was restrained by staff, however it
was noted to be appropriate and involved two Vista Maria staff.
Tour of Facility:
A tour of the area where incident occurred was completed. At the
time of the tour, no areas of concern were noted.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Incident Report – The incident report was completed on
11/23/2024 at 3:49PM by Supervisor 1. The incident report
indicates that "At approximately 11:10am on Saturday, November
24, 2024, Staff 3 came into the administrative hallway of Freedom
Center and stated "you gotta come and get your team leader she is
out of control, I tried to tap her out 3 times and she pushed me out of
the way." Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 went to B wing. Upon opening
the door, Supervisor 1 saw Staff 1 standing over Youth A; who was
sitting in a chair. It appeared that Staff 1 had her forearm in the neck
area of Youth A. Supervisor 1 told Staff 1, "you cannot physically
manage her in a chair, get off the wing now." Youth A was crying
hysterically and began to hit at Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 was able
to calm Youth A down. The lip of Youth A was observed to be
bleeding. Youth A stated, “I am going to fuck her up if she comes
back over here, she punched me in my lip and she was choking me."
Youth A was transported to Henry Ford Fairlane at approximately
3:42pm.
Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – Policy indicates
Prohibited Behavior Intervention Practices. Vista Maria strictly
prohibits excessive or inappropriate use of behavior management
intervention. Behavior management interventions will not be used as
a form of discipline or to force compliance, for the convenience of
7

staff, or for property damage that does not involve threatening
danger to self or others.
Prohibited Physical Intervention Practices include but are not limited
to:
• Personal physical intervention shall not be imposed as a
means of coercion, discipline, convenience, or retaliation by
staff.
• Seclusion (secured or by verbal directive) preventing a
client’s egress from the designated area will not be utilized.
• The use of noxious substances, instruments that cause
temporary incapacitation, and any type of chemical physical
interventions.
• When a client’s individual treatment plan and/or safety plan
indicates adverse effects from physical intervention.
• Prone, supine, and any other physical intervention technique
utilized that may constrict a youth’s breathing.
• Mechanical restraints of any nature (hand cuffs, shackles,
etc.) will not be utilized.
• Four-point restraints and any type of restraint “chair”.
• Behavior management interventions by clients or untrained
staff.
• The use of backwards transport will not be utilized.
• Leg/ankle restriction or physical intervention.
• Wrist physical intervention behind the back.
Human Resources/Discipline file of Staff 1 – Staff 1 has been
employed with the agency for 45 days. There is no disciplinary
action in her employee file.
Henry Ford Hospital Medical Form – Dated 11/23/2024 The medical
records states that the chief complaint is assault victim. It indicated
the following: "This is a 16-year-old female with a history of ADHD,
GAD, separation anxiety living at Vista Maria who presents to the
ED accompanied by staff from Vista Maria for evaluation of lip pain
after an assault that occurred earlier today. Per patient and staff,
patient was having an argument with one of the staff members at
Vista Maria when she spat on her. The staff then pressed her
forearm into the patient's mouth, causing pain in her lip. Lip bleeding
noted from the patient noted to be small, not requiring sutures at this
time, this likely falls in line with the story told by the patient of how
she was struck in the face, potentially causing her own teeth to cut
into her lip.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be in
non-compliance with licensing rule 4158-1-a-ii. Interviews were
completed with both youth and staff and it was determined that
8

agency staff failed to follow the policy and engaged in actions that
were not consistent with the approved behavior management
protocol.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001230 CAP Approved 10/10/2024
Rule Code R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & Rule 158. (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
Section written policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or
otherwise suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Staff made a threat toward Youth
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/4/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at Vista
Maria. The DHHS specialist is also present. She reported that
she is a youth coach and has been employed at Vista Maria for 10
months. She confirmed that she was present on the day of the
incident. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 stated to Youth A “If you spit
on me, I am going to fuck you up and I’ll beat your ass”.
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at
Vista Maria. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1
stated she has been employed by Vista Maria since 10/23/2024.
Staff 1 denied making any threats toward Youth A and denied that
she told her she was going to “fuck her up or beat her ass”.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – Policy indicates
Prohibited Behavior Intervention Practices. Vista Maria strictly
prohibits excessive or inappropriate use of behavior management
intervention. Behavior management interventions will not be used
as a form of discipline or to force compliance, for the convenience
of staff, or for property damage that does not involve threatening
danger to self or others. Prohibited Verbal Practices include but
are not limited to:
• Use of profanity or abusive language directed at or in the
presence of clients.
9

• Harsh or degrading language directed at a client.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 400.158 -1-a-iii. The agency
staff made a threat toward Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C00000229 CAP Approved 03/27/2023
2023C00000531 CAP Approved 07/27/2023
2023C00000606 CAP Approved 07/27/2023
Rule Code R 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Title
Rule Code & Rule 160. The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response
Section for a youth will be limited to: (a) An emergency response to protect
Description the youth or others from an unanticipated or severely
aggressive behavior that places the youth or others at serious
threat of violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Staff initiated an unwarranted emergency restraint on youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at
Vista Maria. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1
stated she has been employed by Vista Maria since 10/23/2024.
She was advised of the allegations and confirmed that she was
working at the agency on the day of the incident. Staff 1 reported
that whenever a resident begins spitting, that results in an
automatic restraint and that is why she grabbed Youth A to
restrain her from spitting and kicking. She further reported that
Youth A was trying to bite her and that is why she put her forearm
into Youth A’s mouth in an attempt to “feed the bite”.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – Policy indicates
Prohibited Behavior Intervention Practices. Vista Maria strictly
prohibits excessive or inappropriate use of behavior management
intervention. Behavior management interventions will not be used
as a form of discipline or to force compliance, for the convenience
of staff, or for property damage that does not involve threatening
danger to self or others.
10

Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 400.4160 a. The agency
staff made a threat toward Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
3/08/2025

Licensing Consultant

11
